title: Soil Health Applied - Crop Diversity and Weed Suppression (3/6)

tasks.task: Engaging in agricultural discussions and operations.
subtasks: Listening to and participating in a conversation about weed management.
Acknowledging the benefits of crop rotation diversity.
Discussing input savings due to reduced herbicide use.
Mentioning the effectiveness of pre- and post-emergent herbicides.
Noting weed pressure management through diverse rotations.
Touching upon the use of small grains in rotations.

tasks.task: Describing the implementation of cover crops.
subtasks: Mentioning the use of radish, vetch, and lentils as cover crops.
Highlighting the benefits of cover crops in breaking compaction.

Describing the preparation of the field for the next crop.
Saying goodbye to the conversation partner.
